headline: Cake Mix Cinnamon Rolls
description: These cake mix cinnamon rolls combine yeast with boxed white cake mix for soft, scrumptious cinnamon rolls. Try this recipe with different cake mixes.

video.description: These cinnamon rolls are made with a box of cake mix!
video.name: How to Make Cake Mix Cinnamon Rolls

name: Cake Mix Cinnamon Rolls
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup chopped pecans, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Pour warm water into a bowl; add yeast and let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes.

Combine yeast mixture, cake mix, and 3 cups of flour in a large bowl; stir well. Add remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring well after each addition until dough pulls together. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes.
Lightly oil a large bowl; place dough in the bowl and turn to coat with oil. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 30 minutes.

Deflate dough and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll the dough into a 10x16-inch rectangle. Spread softened butter over the rectangle; sprinkle on brown sugar and cinnamon. Starting from one of the long sides, roll up the rectangle and cut into 1-inch wide rolls.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.

Pour melted butter into a small bowl. Mix the white sugar and pecans in another small bowl. Dip the top of each roll in melted butter, then in sugar and pecan mixture, then arrange rolls snugly in the prepared pan. Cover rolls with a damp cloth and let rise until doubled in volume, about 30 minutes.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I have literally been looking for this recipe for 30 years! I used it several times (30 years ago) and lost it in a move. I e never been able to find it. This makes the tastiest, moistest cinnamon rolls youâ€™ll ever find. A worthy rival to Cinnabon for sure. Iâ€™m printing, saving, and sharing for sure!! ðŸ’•ðŸ’•
I used the spice cake mix, and added more sugar and cinnamon in the middle, turned out great.
These were great. We added a few more pecans, but that was the only thing different. They were very good, but we can't make these too often. They disappeared quickly.
Very easy and delicious! I'm not good with yeast dough but this recipe did not fail me. I have been successful each time I've used this recipe.
It is a very good recipe. Everybody loves them and I can make a lot of them.
Not as good as sounds dry no flavor

These were excellent. I was afraid they would be too cake like or too sweet but they werenâ€™t. Next time I will put them in two pans - maybe a 9X 13 and an 8 X 8 because they did not cook evenly when crammed into just the one pan. I had to remove the edge ones (by that I mean eat them haha) and put the rest back in the oven for another 15 minutes. I think giving them more room will help with that. I used my kitchen aid mixer to knead the dough and probably used closer to 5 c flour. I dipped the cut rolls into melted butter then placed them in a pan that was sprinkled with 1/3 c brown sugar and pecans. I drizzled a little extra melted butter on top. Highly recommend and will make again!
I don't know what I'm doing wrong they keep coming out heavy & not roaring

I'm always looking for something different and this is just that! I just had to try it out! In my goofiness I added too much water so I just add more flour. Thus resulting in a double batch which is fine by me. I added my own filing and topping because I was only looking for a different dough. The dough was not better or worse, just different. I did find however that the dough was easier to work than standard bread dough. Nice take on an old classic!

My husband loves cinnamon rolls so I thought Iâ€™d try this recipe. He ate 2 so I guess he liked them. I kneaded the dough by hand and just kept adding flour as needed. It wasnâ€™t as hard to work with as some reviewers were saying. Anyway it made a 9x13 and 9x9 pan. So some will go into the freezer.

Video does not follow the Instructions. 
No second resting, topping applied differently and some ingredients. 
Sure they will turn out great either way.
Super yum!

Followed the recipe exactly but the flour measurements where off the dough was very sticky I had to add more flour I think it needs 5 1/2 cups of flour. Anyways it came out well and I got a two thumbs up from my kids.

These are very good! I wish, though, that I had watched the video. I followed it to a T, including Step6, which was a total disaster. Instead of trying to make the rolls, dip them in butter, then dip them in sugar/cinnamon and then letting them rise, the next time I will make the rolls, put them in the pan, let them rise, brush on the butter, then sprinkle on the sugar and pecans. So much easier and cleaner! I am going to try them next time with the "Perfect Cinnamon Roll Icing" mentioned in other posts. I guess it depends on how you wind up cutting them as to how many you fit in the 9x13 pan. I had a few leftover with nowhere for them to fit. Put them in another pan. Try this recipe, you won't be disappointed.

I followed the recipe to the T (at least I thought I did) and I wound up with a sticky, nightmarish mess because I clearly messed up on the amount flour I was supposed to add. HOWEVER, the flavor is awesome and Iâ€™ll make this again and again even though I butchered it this time around. The dough was so sticky I just rolled it the best I could, literally scraped it off my counter top into a 9x13 pan and baked it like a cake. Glazed it and served it warm. It was really good! This will be my go to cinnamon bun recipe. So easy, especially if you have a stand mixer and a dough hook. And Iâ€™ll definitely pay attention to the amount of flour next time I make it!

"Still good, but looked better than they tasted. 'Could be the cook's fault; first time with this recipe, but not cinnamon rolls. I topped with homemade cream cheese frosting. Without frosting, I'd be disappointed; but I didn't dip in butter since I was using frosting. Thanks for the cinnamon rolls.
These were a huge hit with my entire family and I've made them several times!
Good but too rich with cake mix

Very delicious and easy to make. I couldnâ€™t find any active dry yeast (sold out everywhere in stores), so I used instant dry yeast (2 1/4 tsp = 1 pkg - according to my research). I should have taken a step from one of the reviewers and added more cinnamon. I also used cream cheese frosting instead of sugar, butter and pecan topping. The next time I make it (yes, Iâ€™ll make it again) I think Iâ€™ll add raisins.
Makes a very tender dough, and a lot of it. Additionally, it rose so much that I needed an extra 8x8 with the 9x13 pan to accommodate all the rolls.
Turned out really good! I used chocolate cake mix coz I didnâ€™t have the suggested mix.
Very dry, smells & tastes like cake. Regret wasting 3 pkgs of yeast. The best cinnamon rolls take a mashed potato and the potato water.
WORKOUT !

My white cake mix was 3 ounces short of the recipe. Had to add flour otherwise dough very sticky.
Cooked it 5 minutes longer but middle still didn't seem completely cooked.
Added a powdered sugar glaze as it was a bit plain.

I've made several different Cinnamon Roll recipes from this site and this is the best. The taste of the roll itself, minus the sugary goo inside, is excellent. It is the easiest to roll out, which is a major plus, and it is easy to remember with few ingredients and nice round numbers. I made a few mods, and I realize that triggers people, but personally, I read reviews for ideas on how to modify and substitute. My mods, I believe, have no bearing on the quality of this recipe. I make them because I have trouble following rules. If your triggered by mods, please ignore this review. So, I only had 15 oz of cake mix, I added a small box of vanilla pudding and an egg. I used a little more than a tablespoon of Instant Yeast, and used bread flour (because that's all I had). If anything, I believe the bread flour would make it harder to roll out. Oh, and I didn't measure the flour usage too well and I'm sure I used over 5 cups.
The rolls are light and delicious. It calls for a 9x13 pan, but it was way too small for my batch. I used my 17x12 and it was great.

Wow! THE BEST. Iâ€™ve been making cinnamon rolls for Christmas breakfast for 42 years, but they have never been this fluffy and soft. I will never use another recipe. I followed the dough recipe exactly. Based on reviews here, I doubled the butter/sugar/cinnamon filling and it was just the right amount. I used the Cinnabon Clone icing. Perfection.
I wanted it to be wonderful. It sounded so good. The batter was sticky and I had to add a lot of extra flour to even be able to knead it. They were soft and looked really good, but they were bland.
Great, easy recipe. I added nutmeg and cloves with my cinnamon. I also added a glaze to finish.
This was a great recipe. I followed it exactly. It was easy, beautiful looking dough... REALLY delicious!

The picture shows frosting but not in the recipe. My wife added frosting and pecans.
The best cinnamon roll ever.
I didn't like the texture.
Its great I just made sticky buns with it with my granddaughter
used only 2 pkg. yeast but it turned out great. Grandsons 13, 11 helped roll out dough, we had fun and loved the results.
I had yellow cake mix on hand, and it turned out well. Now I have way too many cinnamon buns for two quarantined people to eat., but it was fun to make.
@Lynnabg I couldn't figure out how to respond to your review, however if you rolled out a rectangle of 10 x 16 then you roll the 16" side.
Iâ€™m in the process of making them and everything is going great!

These are good rolls. Soft and pillowy. Easy to make. This recipe is also good in place of a standard recipe that requires bread flour. I didnâ€™t have any so this was great. I read the reviews and added one egg to the dough. I also let my mix master do the kneading for me. I rated 4 stars instead of 5 because the texture was a little different than expected. I would make it again.
I used a muffin tin, made 18 muffins. Could have easily made 24 if I cut smaller. I also put cream cheese frosting because I just wanted the extra calories
Decadent!
Tastes great
I had this recipe (or one just like it) years ago and somehow misplaced it. I've combed cookbooks looking for it and I am SO EXCITED to see it here today!!! Thank You Thank You

Love this recipe. Instead of cinnamon I spread raspberry jam and add frozen raspberries and let them sit overnight in the fridge. I have also used peach jam and canned peaches. The fruit filling is amazing with these rolls.

I used a lemon cake mix, and added lemon zest to the mix. I added lemon extract to the icing. I use the kitchen aid mixer on low speed, when mixing, due to my age an physical ability. Made 24 ?? buns and family loved them. I only got 1 of the buns, they were gone. Will make again.
Turned out great and very tasty. Simple and easy to make. Would have been 5 stars, but I found the amount of flour listed to be far less than required to get the dough to knead.
Not bad, but not as moist as I would have liked. Directions say to dip dough in sugar and pecan mixture, but no pecans I'm the ingredients list. Will try a different recipe next time.

I made it and thought it was just OK, my husband on the other hand loved it but he loves anything with enough frosting on it!
This really has a "cake type" mouth feel to it whereas the "from scratch cinnamon rolls" have more of a stretchy, bread feel. My feeling is if you're going to go through the trouble to use yeast and wait for it to rise you might as well make the real thing, it will have better flavor, a crispiness to the bottom and best of all they don't go stale as fast.

I read some of the other reviews. But made it like the recipe. This was during COVID-19 and I didn't have enough packs of yeast but had bread rapid rise, so my third pack was that and I put a little too much the yeast taste was overwhelming for me. but Hubby loved. THE BEST THING ... I froze 1/2 the roll for later. Brought out, thawed, sliced let rise 30 min - baked etc.. These were the BEST oh My !! they were better than the first 1/2. Freezing to save for later - works.. NOTE they will still rise in the frig. I vacuum sealed the second 1/2 of roll after flash freezing it.
It was a great recipe and I used a cherry chip cake mix. I put the pecans inside the rolls. I thought it was very delicious and awesome.
Great flavor & texture. The dough rose beautifully.
I had to use yellow mix, but yum. I am going to try a spice mix I have on hand just for fun.
Yes. Delicious

I've been making these rolls for years. The only difference is that I put 2 pkg. of yeast in a bowl with the cake mix and 4 cups of flour. and a 1/2 tsp of salt. Then I add warm (120-130 degree) water and mix. I gradually add the rest of the flour then. It has never failed me and the rolls are delicious. I have only used a yellow cake mix for these.
These were so good. Nice and soft.

These taste great, but a little too much of the cake taste to suit me. Also, for me, the amount of dough is too much for the amount of filling and topping - it's a little too bready. I enjoyed them, but I like the other recipe that uses pudding mix in the recipe better.
Was not easy to make, but they were very good.
I made these, they seem to get better with age. Makes a lot I froze some. I just got a new bread machine and I am going to try in that on the dough cycle. They are really good.

halved the recipe, and only used 2 tbs butter to spread on the dough, but much much more cinnamon. i used a milk chocolate cake mix, and let the bread machine mix, knead and rose the dough. easy peasy.

This recipe has been my "go to" recipe for quite some time now. However, I've noted this posting utilizes a third pack of yeast, as compared to the previously posted identical recipe which only used 2 and resulted with a more dense texture. The addition of a cake mix provides limitless options. Why not a strawberry cake mix with a preserve filling, or lemon cake mix with coconut filling? Trust me. You will love trying this one! I'm going to try a carrot cake mix with cinnamon raisin filling and cream cheese frosting next.

Outstanding Exactly as written. My husband wanted something close to what he had in school and this was it. Great with his bean chowder.
I will be making again very soon.

I have made these many times. The only thing I changed is I let them rise overnight in the fridge. I also skip the dipping in sugar and nuts and just brush with butter before baking. I add the "Clone of Cinnabon" Cream Cheese Icing, They are to die for! I have used yellow and white cake mixes, both are good. I probably add extra butter and sugar, just make sure the entire inside is covered well.

The dough was great to work with. Rolled out smooth and proofed well. But they need to be eaten immediately because the dough doesnâ€™t have a lot of moisture. If I make these again Iâ€™ll add butter or sour cream to the dough and see if that helps.
So good. It will make your mouth water
I absolutely adored making my own cinnamon rolls I love this recipe!!!
We loved these rolls. Followed the recipe exactly but no frosting. Didn't need it. Next time I will use about 1/2 cup of brownsugar. Great fresh and as a leftover.
I will make again, but I could barely taste the cake mix. But they were good.

Love cinnamon rolls and couldnâ€™t believe I could make such perfect ones myself. Does this still count as scratch with the help of a box mix? The prior reviews were so helpful as I too selected French vanilla cake mix and instead of adding more flour because it was too wet, I decreased the water to 2 cups.

So good! Bread-like texture and so beautiful! 
Next time I make the dough stick thinner so they come out bite-sized as they are quite chunky following the recipe. Taste homely and kids used them in their packed lunch for multiple days!

Best ever!
I made them a second time and doubled the Brown Sugar and butter inside, plus sprinkled the inside with almonds. 
Then when you dip the top in butter, sugar and pecans, I also added cinnamon and dips the sides in the mixture as well. 
They were amazing.
I even added a cream cheese glaze to th top later! Yum
I followed the recipe except I didn't add pecans. It was very time consuming and they turned out very dry tasting
Made it twice way too much batter for sugar & cinnamon and could use more cinnamon plus makes a very large amt

I made these rolls last week exactly like the recipe says. Today I didnâ€™t have a white cake mix so I used a yellow cake mix. I divided the dough in half and made two dozen. I didnâ€™t dip them or put butter on top. I made the glaze I always make for cinnamon rolls. I love this recipe.
This was great! Only thing is that I needed a larger pan because this makes a LOT of cinnamon rolls. Rolls were tender and tasted like rolls from a bakery. This recipe is a keeper...thank you!
Made exactly as recipe called for. Will skip the white sugar next time, very sweet. Overall delicious and everyone liked them. Made more than recipe stated.

I followed the dough recipe exactly as presented however my cake mix was 15.25 oz, not the 18.25 oz called for in the recipe. I split the dough in half to roll it out. I cooked them in 3 glass pie pans and it made 30 rolls. I added raisins to the filling, some extra brown sugar, and some white sugar. Great recipe!!
These were a big hit w my family of 6! I did not have any regular flour so I used gluten free flour and it still turned out yummy! We will definitely make these again.
It was delicious!

It was okay but really made way too much dough for just one pan of rolls. If I make it again, I will probably make it into 2 dozen rolls and roll them thinner.

Very light. Easy and quick to make.

Bar none one of the best cinnamon rolls I ever tasted. The remind me of the ones I had in grade school. This is an awesome, easy, fast recipe that could be tweaked in so many ways. BUT before you do try them just the way the recipe reads. You won't regret it. Next time I'm adding raisins or cherries and doubling up on the brown sugar, I like em messy.

I used instant rise yeast and since recipe was so large broke dough into 2 and added ground pan sausage to half and bacon to other for sweet and savory cinnamon rolls although brown sugar made it really sweet will use regular sugar next time. Also nade it again but used dough to make kolaches with them. Turned out great also. Family and friends loved both. Will be using again in future
I absolutely loved them. They were really easy to make. Would definitely make them again.
awesome
Followed directions to the letter. GREAT results !
Yes I will make it again very good
Everyone loved them! This recipe made 30 rolls. I used quick rise yeast and used cream cheese frosting.
Made it by the recipe. Had a bunch of happy firefighters
It was so good and eaten so fast
Added extra coconut. Will make again

I made this twice. After reading all the comments about how wet the dough is and how it makes about 2 dozen large rolls with all the flour that is added, I halved the recipe and only used 1c of liquid (1/2 c water + 1/2 c almond milk) with 2 teaspoons of yeast - 3 packages seems like way too much! I did not want to make such a large quantity so halving it worked out well for me.
I ended up adding about 2 1/2 c of flour. I still got 10 good sized rolls and baked them in a 9 x 9 pan. I didn't dip in butter and sugar and used a cream cheese icing instead but felt it needed more cinnamon flavor. The bread flavor was good and the texture was pretty light but I would not consider it cakelike as some people described. 
My DH really enjoyed them so I made it again a few days later using the other half of the cake mix. This time I sliced into 9 rolls so they fit perfectly into my 9 x 9 pan. I increased the amount of cinnamon to 1 1/2 teaspoons and dipped the top side in cinnamon sugar (no nuts) this time.
By the way, I use sewing thread to "slice" my rolls. Just wrap the thread around where you want the cut, cross the ends of the thread and pull. You get a nice clean cut without squishing or flattening the rolls. I also used someone's else's tip of smashing down the center of the roll so it does not rise in a dome shape. 
I'm wondering if anyone has had any luck freezing the rolls? It would be so convenient to take out as many as needed and letting them thaw and rise before baking so

I've made this recipe at least 20 times, so easy and so good. The only change I make is to divide my dough into 2 parts and roll each out and add butter, sugar and cinnamon, this way the rolls are smaller and make more. I omit the sugar, nut, butter mix and ice with cream cheese frosting once they cool. I usually cook for large groups and have tons of other food available, that's why I make them smaller.
These Look Good
Need recipe to try
Soft and moist !
Added 1 more tsp cinnamon..my husband likes them

I like cinnamon rolls with a bit of chew in them, and this recipe makes them turn out too "cakey." Also, there wasn't enough liquid to use all the flour without the dough being way too stiff. I used 3.5 cups (along with the cake mix) and it seemed about right but still took at least an hour to rise (yes, I kneaded the dough at least 10 minutes). After rolling them out and putting them into the pan, it took a little less time for them to rise, and they turned out beautifully. They were good, but not delicious, and even though I had a crowd to feed and they were grateful for them, no one said how good they were. They were sort of "meh." I'll keep looking for the perfect cinnamon roll...

I made this Christmas morning w/ a butter pecan cake mix-everyone LOVED it and it was to die for!! They were so soft and gooey! My first time making bread of any kind, it was a very ready recipe!! It made 16 rolls. I let it rise covered in the fridge overnight, and make cream cheese frosting for the top. (1 pkg cream cheese softened, 1 cup powdered sugar, 1/2 tsp vanilla, 6 tbs butter softened) make sure not to over bake.

I make these every time now, I use a vanilla in everything, so I add a teaspoon to the dough, always turns out moist and wonderful. Next batch I am going to experiment w/ coconut milk as I have found even in cake recipes makes more moist longer.

I used a 1 1/2 cups of the brown sugar center and chopped some pecans into the mix with the cinnamon. Somehow I'm not seeing an icing recipe or ingredients so made a basic powdered sugar, butter (creamed) and milk basic icing. The dough was really sticky so just stay with 8 minutes of kneading. Also the directions call for pecans but did not see it listing in the ingredients when I made my batch.

I will make this again and try as other suggested using a spice cake recipe. Will also knead less, rather than keep adding flour to help make it smooth and less sticky. Will also add another teaspoon of cinnamon.

Why does this recipe have so much yeast in it? Am I reading that right, 3~packages yeast. That comes to 6 3/4 teaspoon yeast for what is essentially almost 7 cups of flour (including flour in the mix). Please let me know.
